description: First occurrence of n consecutive numbers that take same number of steps to reach 1 in 3x+1 problem.
comments: Sequence is precise in the sense that n+1 consecutive numbers starting at a(n) do not take the same number of steps.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
mathematica: Collatz[n_] := Length[NestWhileList[If[EvenQ[#], #/2, 3 # + 1] &, n, # > 1 &]] - 1; nn = 10; t = Table[0, {nn}]; t[[1]] = 1; rep = 1; last = 0; n = 1; While[Times @@ t == 0, n++;  r = Collatz[n]; If[r == last, rep++, If[0 < rep <= nn && t[[rep]] == 0, t[[rep]] = n - rep]; last = r; rep = 1]]; t (* _T. D. Noe_, Jun 20 2012 *)
